fullProgramDescription: The Bachelor of Science in Economics provides students with a comprehensive understanding of economic theory, econometrics, and applied economics. The program emphasizes both theoretical foundations and empirical analysis, preparing students for careers in government, private sector, and graduate study.
shortProgramDescription: The Economics B.S. at UC San Diego provides a rigorous education in economic theory and empirical methods, preparing students for diverse careers or further study.
classHighlights: The lower-division courses provide a foundation in microeconomics, macroeconomics, and mathematical tools. Students take ECON1,2,3, and MATH2,3,10A,10B, or20A,20B.
The upper-division core courses cover microeconomic theory (ECON100A,100B), macroeconomic theory (ECON101A,101B), and econometrics (ECON120A,120B,120C).
Students choose from a range of electives, including courses in economic history, international trade, public finance, labor economics, and industrial organization.
The major also allows for flexibility in choosing electives to tailor the program to individual interests and career goals.
Students are encouraged to take courses that provide a strong foundation for graduate study or professional careers.
learningOutcomes: Understand and apply microeconomic and macroeconomic theories.
Analyze economic data using econometric techniques.
Evaluate economic policies and their impacts.
Apply economic principles to real-world problems.
Demonstrate an understanding of the global economy and its interdependencies.
additionalInformation: Students must complete all lower-division and upper-division core courses with a grade of C- or higher. The major GPA is calculated based on upper-division economics courses.
